casebody.data:
McLAUGHLIN, et al.
v.
BAILEY, et al. No. 163A15-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. Nov. 2, 2015. Harvey L. Kennedy, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for McLaughlin, Ivan, et al. Harold L. Kennedy, III, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for McLaughlin, Ivan, et al. Sean F. Perrin, Charlotte, Attorney at Law, for Bailey, Daniel, et al. William G. Simpson, Jr., Kinston, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Advocates for Justice. Jon Ward, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Advocates for Justice. Edmond W. Caldwell, Jr., Executive Vice President and General Counsel, for North Carolina Sheriffs' Association.

Opinion

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 29th of October 2015 by North Carolina Sheriffs' Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 2nd of November 2015."
ERVIN, J. Recused.

Unless already submitted, the North Carolina Sheriffs' Association's Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
